#description+long+en: Accessiblity and constraints on access to a market, distribution point, facility, etc.
#meta+example+description+en: type of access being described

#description+long+en: A programme, project, or other activity. This hashtag applies to all levels; use the attributes +activity, +project, or +programme to distinguish different hierarchical levels.
#meta+example+description+en: an aid project

#description+long+en: Top-level subnational administrative area (e.g. a governorate in Syria).
#meta+example+description+en: administrative level 1 P-code

#description+long+en: Second-level subnational administrative area (e.g. a subdivision in Bangladesh).
#meta+example+description+en: administrative level 2 name

#description+long+en: Third-level subnational administrative area (e.g. a subdistrict in Afghanistan).
#meta+example+description+en: administrative level 3 P-code

#description+long+en: Fourth-level subnational administrative area (e.g. a barangay in the Philippines).
#meta+example+description+en: administrative level 4 name

#description+long+en: Fifth-level subnational administrative area (e.g. a ward of a city).
#meta+example+description+en: administrative level 5 name

#description+long+en: Number of people or households affected by an emergency. Subset of #population; superset of #inneed.
#meta+example+description+en: number of girls affected

#description+long+en: General (non-numeric) information about a person or group meant to benefit from aid activities, e.g. "lactating women".
#meta+example+description+en: text label for a beneficiary group

#description+long+en: The response capacity of the entity being described (e.g. "25 beds").
#meta+example+description+en: number of (whatever) available

#description+long+en: The cause of an event, crisis, etc.
#meta+example+description+en: unique code for the cause of a crisis or event

#description+long+en: The detailed method of delivering aid (e.g. smartcard vs mobile transfer). More specific than #modality.
#meta+example+description+en: text label for a specific delivery channel

#description+long+en: Contact information for the subject of a data record (e.g. an activity).
#meta+example+description+en: e-mail address for contacting an organisation or person

#description+long+en: Country (often left implied in a dataset). Also sometimes known as admin level 0.
#meta+example+description+en: country name

#description+long+en: A humanitarian emergency.
#meta+example+description+en: a code identifying a crisis (a GLIDE number by default)

#description+long+en: Name or ISO 4217 currency code for all financial #value cells in the row (e.g. "EUR"). Typically used together with #value in financial or cash data.
Date related to the data in the record applies. Preferred format is ISO 8610 (e.g. “2015-06-01”, “2015-Q1”, etc.)
#meta+example+description+en: the date when something began

#description+long+en: [Under discussion] Information about the delivery of aid other than the modality, such as restrictions on use, financial tool (smartcards vs mobile transfer), etc.
Long description for a data record.
#meta+example+description+en: Arabic-language version of a description

#description+long+en: An individual event or incident within a crisis/emergency, such as a (localised) flood, bridge collapse, or conflict.
#meta+example+description+en: type of event

#description+long+en: The frequency with which something occurs.
#meta+example+description+en: unique code for a frequency level

#description+long+en: Geodetic geometry information (points, lines, shapes). Use for latitude and longitude, as well as bounds information.
#meta+example+description+en: latitude

#description+long+en: A non-humanitarian group (of any type) related to humanitarian crisis (e.g., a paramilitary group) Use #org instead for a humanitarian organisation such as an NGO, contributing to the humanitarian response.
#meta+example+description+en: name of a non-humanitarian actor, such as a political party

#description+long+en: The impact of a crisis on a group or other entity.
#meta+example+description+en: unique code for the type of impact

#description+long+en: A general hashtag for an indicator being tracked. See also #output, #capacity, #need, #impact, #severity, #affected, #inneed, #targeted, and #reached for more-specific indicator-related hashtags.
Number of people or households in need of humanitarian assistance. Subset of #affected; superset of #targeted.
#meta+example+description+en: number of men in need of assistance

#description+long+en: Physical things provided, stored, shipped, available, used, etc.
#meta+example+description+en: unique code for an item (e.g. type of food in a market)

#description+long+en: Any general location, such as a village, camp, or clinic.
#meta+example+description+en: type of location

#description+long+en: Metadata about a row.
#meta+example+description+en: unique identifier for a data record

#description+long+en: The means by which an aid activity is accomplished. For cash transfers, values might include "cash", "vouchers", "in-kind", etc. May also be used for other types of modalities in other contexts.
#meta+example+description+en: unique code for an aid modality

#description+long+en: A(n) (unfulfilled) need for an affected person, household, group, or population.
#meta+example+description+en: text label for a need

#description+long+en: Information that affects humanitarian operations, such as a restriction on movement or road closure.

An organisation contributing to a humanitarian emergency response, e.g. a local government, community-based organisation, NGO, agency, donor, or law-enforcement or military unit. Use #group for organisations that are not part of the emergency response (e.g. a paramilitary group).
#meta+example+description+en: donor (financial)

#description+long+en: An output indicator (e.g. “number of water-purification kits distributed”). A more-specific alternative to #indicator, especially for 3W-style activity reports.
#meta+example+description+en: number of items delivered, people helped, etc

#description+long+en: General population number for an area or location, regardless of their specific humanitarian needs.
#meta+example+description+en: number of infants in the population

#description+long+en: Number of people or households reached with humanitarian assistance. Subset of #targeted.
#meta+example+description+en: number of boys reached with assistance

#description+long+en: A broad, supra- or cross-national geographical region (e.g. Sahel, Horn of Africa, Central Asia, Caribbean). Not to be confused with "region" used as the name of a subnational area (#adm1) in some countries.
#meta+example+description+en: Urdu-language name for a geographical region

#description+short+en: Person etc responding to a survey
#description+long+en: Descriptive information, such as name, identifier, or traits, for a single respondee (person, household, etc.) in survey-style data.
A humanitarian cluster or sector.
#meta+example+description+en: name of an IASC humanitarian cluster

#description+long+en: A service used or needed by an affected person, household, group, or population.
Severity of the crisis or event.
#meta+example+description+en: text label for the severity level

#description+long+en: Project/activity status description (such as “planned”, “active”, “canceled”, or “complete”).
#meta+example+description+en: unique code for the status level

#description+long+en: A humanitarian subsector.
#meta+example+description+en: Arabic-language name for a subsector.

#description+long+en: Number of people or households targeted for humanitarian assistance. Subset of #inneed; superset of #reached.
#meta+example+description+en: number of women targeted for assistance

#description+long+en: A monetary value, such as the price of goods in a market, a project budget, or the amount of cash transferred to beneficiaries. May be used together with #currency in financial or cash data.
#meta+example+description+en: amount transferred
